question: A Sustainable Development Cell has been recently established by which ministry in India?
explanation: The Ministry of Coal announced that it is to establish a Sustainable Development Cell in the country. The cell will gain significance as the new private entities will form a significant part of the future. It also plans to set guidelines for proper rehabilitation of mines in tune with the global best practices.The aim of the cell is to promote environmentally sustainable coal mining in India. It will also address environmental concerns during the decommissioning or closure of mines. The Sustainable Development cell (SDC) will plan, advise, mentor, and monitor the mitigation measures that are taken by the coal companies to maximize the utilization of available resources in a sustainable way.
